verses.text: 耶穌和門徒走近耶路撒冷，來到橄欖山的伯法其那裡。耶穌派了兩個門徒，
對他們說：「你們往對面的村子裡去，立刻就會看見一頭驢拴在那裡，還有小驢跟牠在一起。把牠們解開，牽來給我。
如果有人問你們，就要說：『主需要牠們。』他會立刻讓你們牽走。」

words.note: Title for God or Jesus

verses.text: 這件事應驗了先知所說的：

words.note: Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase

verses.text: 「要對錫安的居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）說：『看哪，你的王來到你這裡了；他是溫柔的，他騎著驢，騎的是小驢。』」

words.note: An exclamation, common in biblical texts.
Nominalized verb phrase: 'that which is ridden'

verses.text: 門徒照著耶穌的吩咐去作。

words.note: Lit. 'gate student', meaning one who enters through a teacher's door.
Can also be a verb: to instruct, command.

verses.text: 牽了驢和小驢來，把衣服搭在牠們上面，耶穌就騎上。

words.note: Used to move the object before the verb.
牠 (tā) is the character for 'it' or 'them' (animals).

verses.text: 有一大群人把自己的衣服鋪在路上，也有人從樹上把樹枝砍下來，鋪在路上。
前呼後擁的群眾喊叫著：「『和散那』歸於大衛的子孫，奉主名來的是應當稱頌的，高天之上當唱『和散那』。」

words.note: An idiom describing a large crowd surrounding and following someone important.
A transliteration of a Hebrew word meaning 'save now' or 'save, please'.
More formal than 屬於 (shǔyú), common in religious texts.
Formal, often used in religious or official contexts.
A more formal way of saying 'above' or 'on top of'.

verses.text: 耶穌進了耶路撒冷，全城都震動起來，他們問：「這人是誰？」

words.note: Describes a sudden or significant shaking/stirring.

verses.text: 大家都說：「這就是那先知耶穌，是從加利利的拿撒勒來的。」

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'

verses.text: 耶穌進了聖殿，把殿裡所有作買賣的人趕走，並推倒找換銀錢的人的桌子，和賣鴿子的人的凳子；

words.note: Lit. 'holy hall'
Lit. 'buy and sell'

verses.heading: Cleansing the Temple

verses.text: 又對他們說：「經上記著：『我的殿要稱為禱告的殿。』你們竟把它弄成賊窩了。」
殿裡的瞎子和瘸腿的都走過來，耶穌就醫好他們。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'the lame ones'
Lit. 'heal to completion'

verses.text: 祭司長和經學家看見耶穌所行的奇事，又看見小孩子在殿中喊叫「『和散那』歸於大衛的子孫」，就很忿怒，

words.note: Lit. 'chief manager of sacrifices'
Lit. 'expert in studying classics'
Lit. 'strange event'
Lit. 'children and grandchildren'
Emphasizes intense anger.

verses.text: 對耶穌說：「你聽見他們說甚麼嗎？」耶穌說：「我聽見了。『你從小孩和嬰兒的口中，得著了讚美。』這話你們沒有念過嗎？」

words.note: Also written as 什麼.
Often used to mean 'from the mouth of' in biblical context.
Literally 'get and attain', indicating successful reception.

verses.text: 於是離開他們，出了城，來到伯大尼，在那裡過了一夜。
耶穌清早回城的時候，覺得餓了。
verses.heading: The Withered Fig Tree

verses.text: 他看見路旁有一棵無花果樹，就走過去；但他在樹上甚麼也找不到，只有葉子，就對樹說：「你永遠不再結果子了。」那棵樹就立刻枯萎。
門徒看見了，十分驚奇，說：「這棵無花果樹是怎樣立刻枯萎的呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'door follower', referring to students of a master.
Used with 是...的 to inquire about manner or time.

verses.text: 耶穌回答他們：「我實在告訴你們，如果你們有信心，不懷疑，不但能作我對無花果樹所作的，就是對這座山說『移開，投到海裡去』，也必成就。

words.note: Lit. 'believing heart'; often means religious faith.
Lit. 'tree without flowers that bears fruit'.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.

verses.text: 你們禱告，無論求甚麼，只要相信，都必得著。」

words.note: Compound verb, lit. 'pray and declare'.
Often written as 得着.

verses.text: 耶穌進了聖殿，正在教導人的時候，祭司長和民間的長老前來問他：「你憑甚麼權柄作這些事？誰給你這權柄？」

words.note: Refers to a holy building, often specifically the Jerusalem Temple.

words.definition: in the process of, just now

words.note: Refers to a high-ranking priest in ancient Israel.
Refers to a leader or senior member, often in a religious context.

verses.heading: The Authority of Jesus

verses.text: 耶穌回答他們：「我也要問你們一句話，如果你們告訴我，我就告訴你們我憑甚麼權柄作這些事。
約翰的洗禮是從哪裡來的呢？是從天上來的，還是從人來的呢？」他們就彼此議論：「如果我們說『是從天上來的』，他會問我們『那你們為甚麼不信他呢？』

words.note: A religious rite of purification.

verses.text: 如果我們說『是從人來的』，我們又怕群眾，因為他們都認為約翰是先知。」

words.note: Indicates something that comes from, or belongs to.
Here implies 'on the other hand' or 'furthermore'.
Lit. 'first to know'.

verses.text: 於是回答耶穌：「我們不知道。」耶穌也對他們說：「我也不告訴你們，我憑甚麼權柄作這些事。

words.note: Refers to both power and the right to wield it.

verses.text: 「你們認為怎樣？有一個人，他有兩個兒子。他去對大兒子說：『孩子，你今天到葡萄園去工作吧。』

words.note: Indicates suggestion or mild command.

verses.heading: The Parable of the Two Sons

verses.text: 他說：『我不想去。』但後來他改變主意，就去了。

words.note: Lit. 'main idea'.
Indicates completion or a change of state.

verses.text: 父親又照樣去吩咐小兒子。小兒子說：『父親，我會去的。』後來卻沒有去。

words.note: Indicates certainty or emphasis.

verses.text: 這兩個兒子，哪一個聽父親的話呢？」他們說：「大兒子。」耶穌對他們說：「我實在告訴你們：稅吏和娼妓比你們先進 神的國。

words.note: Can mean 'obey' when referring to words or commands.
Here means 'eldest' as in '大兒子' (eldest son).
Often viewed negatively in biblical times.
Used in a social outcast context in the Bible.
Often preceded by a reverence space in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 約翰來到你們那裡，指示你們行義路（或譯：「約翰在義路中，來到你們這裡」），你們不信他；稅吏和娼妓卻信了他。你們看見了之後，還是沒有改變心意去信他。
「你們再聽一個比喻：有一個家主，栽種了一個葡萄園，四面圍上籬笆，在園子裡挖了一個壓酒池，蓋了一座瞭望臺，然後把園子租給佃戶，就遠行去了。

words.note: A pit or basin used for pressing grapes to make wine.
A tower for guarding a field or vineyard.

verses.heading: The Parable of the Tenants

verses.text: 到了收成的時候，園主派了僕人到佃戶那裡，收取應該納給他的果子。

words.note: 納 often refers to paying tribute or tax.

verses.text: 佃戶卻抓住他的僕人，打傷一個，殺了一個，又用石頭打死一個。
於是園主再派其他的僕人去，人數比前一次更多，但佃戶也是同樣對付他們。

words.note: Specifically refers to the owner of a vineyard/orchard.
Refers to a domestic or hired servant, less common than 'employee' in modern use.
Refers to a person who rents and farms land, typically a historical/biblical concept.

verses.text: 最後，他派了自己的兒子去，說：『他們必尊敬我的兒子。』

words.note: Indicates completion or a change of state.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity, more formal than 一定.

verses.text: 佃戶看見他的兒子，就彼此說：『這是繼承產業的；來，我們殺了他，佔有他的產業吧！』

words.note: Refers to a person who rents and farms land, typically a historical/biblical concept.
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
In this context, refers to inherited property or estate.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb or adjective.
Indicates completion or a change of state.
In this context, refers to inherited property or estate.
Indicates a suggestion, request, or mild command.

verses.text: 於是他們抓住他，把他推出葡萄園外殺了。

words.note: Used to bring the object of a verb before the verb.
Functions as a directional complement here, indicating movement outwards.
Refers to a specific type of cultivated garden for grapes, common in biblical narratives.
Indicates completion or a change of state.

verses.text: 那麼，葡萄園的主人來到的時候，會怎樣對待那些佃戶呢？」

words.note: Refers to a specific type of cultivated garden for grapes, common in biblical narratives.
Indicates the successful arrival of an action.
Used to turn a verb phrase into a noun phrase, meaning 'the time when...'
Indicates future tense or possibility.
Refers to a person who rents and farms land, typically a historical/biblical concept.
Used at the end of a question to soften it or ask 'what about...?'

verses.text: 他們回答：「他會毫不留情地除掉那些惡人，把葡萄園租給按時繳納果子的佃戶。」

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for 'wicked people'.
Can have spiritual meaning in biblical context.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「經上記著：『建築工人所棄的石頭，成了房角的主要石頭；這是主所作的，在我們眼中看為希奇。』這話你們沒有念過嗎？

words.note: Often used symbolically in the Bible.
Refers to God or Jesus in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 因此我告訴你們， 神的國要從你們那裡取去，賜給那結果子的外族人。

words.note: Often preceded by an honorific space (　神) in religious texts.
神的國 (kingdom of God) is a key biblical concept.
Acts as an adjective here, describing the Gentiles.

verses.text: 誰跌在這石頭上，就必摔碎；這石頭掉在誰的身上，就必把他壓得粉碎。」
祭司長和法利賽人聽了耶穌這些比喻，知道是指著他們說的。
他們想要逮捕他，但又怕群眾，因為他們都認為耶穌是先知。

words.note: Often combined with '但' to mean 'but also' or 'yet still'.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
